name: The Westin Arlington Gateway

reviews.text: I ran for a charity for the Marine Corps Marathon and this was their host hotel. Due to Hurricane Sandy my flight out Monday morning was delayed for several days and the hotel was happy to continue my "group block" rate for the extra 2 nights. They did everything to make the hotel cozy, from candles in the lobby to putting up the Starbucks (located in the hotel) employees over night to ensure guests would have breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: Unexpected extended stay...

reviews.text: The room was incredibly clean and the beds as comfy as home. I loved the shampoo, conditioner, body wash, body lotion and hand soap amenities and they were refreshed as needed. The in-room refrigerator turned out to be an added bonus as I was able to store some meal left-overs and save a few $'s.
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for last year's marathon and was very pleased when my charity returned here again.
reviews.title: Excellent stay for Marine Corps Marathon

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, the staff helpful, and the location is just three blocks from the Metro. We had a room on the 14th floor (one of two club floors). Because we were there for a conference I paid the additional cost for accessing the club room which came to $60/night. It wasn't worth it. Minimal food, no alcohol, no club hours after mid-day on Friday through the weekend. Our room was fine although some of the TV stations either didn't come in or had no sound. Watch out for how heavy the closet doors are - I broke two nails immediately upon arriving when I tried to open them. The refrigerator in the room was locked. There was a note on it telling us we could order some items that could be delivered to stock it. A coworker said her frig was unlocked so I don't really know what the usual policy is. I assume you could always just call the desk and have them unlock it for you. Also, the gift shop isn't really a gift shop. There seems to be a few items (candy bars, aspirin, etc.) that were displayed in a case by the restaurant/bar. I'm guessing you can find someone to sell them to you. Please do not take this as a bad review - I'm just pointing out the few things that weren't the best. On the plus side, the staff members we spoke with were exceptionally helpful. And the room did come with complimentary bottles of water. I would definitely come back, just not to the club floor.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: This was one of the marathon hotels - and they delivered. There was a pasta dinner the night before, there was a 5 am (or later) runner's breakfast option of banana, Gatorade, and power bar for a reasonable price...and for those wishing a la carte, the hotel Starbucks opened at 5 am!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: This is a pleasant facility with a nice staff located in Arlington. A short cab ride from Reagan Airport and downtown DC. Cabs are not plentiful after hours, but the valet will get you one with a minimal wait.
reviews.title: Good business hotel in Arlington

reviews.text: Front desk staff was helpful and prompt. The lobby is modern and comfortable with a nice restaurant and lounge. Rooms are reasonably sized and have the standard amenities. Free bottles of water were available in the rooms on the club floor - not sure if that is the same throughout the other floors. Climate control in the rooms was excellent and included a user controllable fan setting which so many hotels do not offer these days. I was able to set the fan to high which gave me sufficient ventilation and soft background noise which I like. TV was adequate but not impressive. Ample plug access for chargers, etc in the room. Wifi available in a range of speeds and prices. Not unreasonable for a business hotel, but a shame that more still don't make basic wifi free.
reviews.title: Most excellent welcome & help from Cal Alde, Concierge

reviews.text: Room service was prompt and food was good.
reviews.title: Made my trip to DC great

reviews.text: All in all a good experience for a short business trip.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.text: THe Concierge @ the Westin in Arlington, VA is a most helpful, gracious, welcoming Host. Loved staying here mostly due to Cal Alde's warm, empathetic and helpful can-do attitude.
reviews.title: Another wonderful shelter in a storm
This hotel stay was a series of mishaps
reviews.text: From making my reservation, to my arrival to ordering room service... this hotel stay was a series of mishaps. I had called to book a room for a conference I was attending, and the reservation agent didn't have record of our code and rate, and quoted me naerly $300 per night I asked for the hotel manager to contact me. When I didn't hear back, I ended up booking through Expedia. Is it just me, or do hotels save their worst rooms for those booked through third-party sites? About a week later, I recieved an EMAIL from the hotel and I asked them to call me, but never did hear back from anyone. When I arrived, the hotel staff was very pleasant and I was assigned to a very basic room. I went to my meeting and returned to the room after dinner, looking forward to a night in watching TV and having a light dessert. I called room service and ordered a cookie. They said that they had a cookie and icecream and so that is what I ordered. I then turned on the TV... or tried to... checked remote, physically pressed the power button, checked the cords... nothing. I called and they sent up an engineer. By this time, room service delivered... a brownie alamode. I called again to the front desk, and they said they were out of cookies and the chef just substituted a brownie. Since I didnt want a brownie, especially not one that cost $12, I asked them to remove it from my bill, and they did so. The engineer made it up to my room. After 45 minutes of watching the engineer try the same steps I had made, they dedided to move me to a different room. I repacked and moved from the 8th floor to the 13th floor... to an identical room. But at least the TV sort of worked in this one. The TV sound would cut out every couple of minutes, and the picture was pixelated. Im not sure why as the weather was good. It was more than frustrating when youre used to having a quality connection. The room itself was an average or slightly smaller than average size. The walls are a dreary sage and desperately need to be updated. The linens were all a crisp white and the bed was comfy. The shower had double heads which was nice, but the drain wouldnt stay open without having to hold it, so that was annoying. There was also nearly zero water pressure from the sink... regardless of which tap, only a dribble of water would come out at a time. Also, the bathroom door would not stay open. It would automatically close, which was a little freaky when coming into the room and seeing a closed door (every horror movie of the bad guy hiding out in the bathroom would spring to mind). On the second night, I returned to my new room after a long day of meetings with about 45 minutes to change for dinner. And... my keys no longer worked. Frustrated, I went to the front desk where I had to get rekeyed. Happily, the front desk attendant, Michelle, was very lovely and did everything she could to remedy the situation. Her customer service was fantastic and she was the only reason that I did not ask to vent my experiences to her manager. Other notes about this property, it is conveniently located... metro stop is in walking distance. There are lots of little restaurants and coffee shops nearby, including an on-site Starbucks. The "gift shop" was a complete joke... it is only a window display with price tags, so if you need something, you apparently have to go to the front desk and ask for the items. There is also a restaurant, but I did not eat there. All in all, I felt as though the hotel experience was less than satisfactory and took up way too much time from my very busy agenda. I was more than happy to check out. I am still just curious if others have had a problem of poor rooms being given or if they have less than stellar service if the rooms were not booked directly with the hotel. I stay at Starwood properties several times a year and have been a rewards member for years and years. Im hoping my recent experieces is not a sign of a trend.
And two blocks from the Metro. A few bucks and twenty minutes or less to the Mall.

reviews.title: Excellent Location and Very Quiet

reviews.text: We stayed during the MCM and had a great experience. The hotel was nice and clean, the staff was helpful and professional. Loved having the Starbucks onsite. Great location - convenient to many restaurants and the metro. My only complaint would be the internet! I was kind of shocked that not only was internet not included in the room charge, but that there wasn't wireless internet! We stayed at a pretty low-budget hotel the night before we checked into the Westin and wireless internet was included. I would expect the same from a nicer hotel like the Westin.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for the Marine Corps Marathon and like other reviewers had to extend due to the weather. I would have given this hotel 5 stars for the staff but when we needed to extend they were really so helpful and accomodating, nothing was too much trouble. The team here are really a credit to the manager and Westin organisation. Back to the hotel its an excellent location a short walk to the subway and some ok restaurants in the area. The room was spacious and absolutely spotless. Even though we looked over the main road it was still quiet. Due to the weather I am sure that there were many additional guests in the restaurant but the staff maintained a high level of professionalism and calm, keeping us informed of what was happening in the kitchen.
reviews.title: Staff at this hotel are so friendly and helpful

reviews.text: It may seem odd to remember a hotel primarily for its beer - after all, they're not usually the first place you would head to in search of good beer. But the Westin Arlington Gateway had 7 draught craft beers available when I stayed and a good few more available in bottles. That's a really unusual range for a place of this type, and it was clear that the bar staff knew about what they were selling.
reviews.title: Good rooms, good facilities, good location, great bar!

reviews.text: Quite apart from the beer, the hotel is ideally situated in Arlington, close to a Metro station convenient for the Mall and within walking distance of agencies such as NSF. There's a number of interesting restaurants and bars nearby, but the food in the hotel's own restaurant is well worth trying as well. The rooms are excellent and the staff can't be faulted. It's pricy, but so is just about everything else in this area.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Westin Arlington Gateway Hotel for business travel. Stayed about 6 days and the staff was real nice. Steven the bell boy was very nice and helpful. The hotel is very clean and housekeeping does a fabulous job. Tried breakfast at the restuarant but it was ok and very pricey! $20 for 1 person to eat breakfast is expensive but other than that my stay was great.
reviews.title: Updated Rooms
